title: U2F and WebHID support
content: I understand that U2F and WebHID functionality were broken in version 114. This is a problem for those of us who use crypto wallets in Firefox and want to connect to our Ledger hardware wallet. Are there plans to fix this in the near future?
creator: peterbutlin1

title: Bookmarks Problem
content: Firefox for Mac - Version 119.0 (Latest update) Bookmarks Organization within the Sidebar When Sidebar open, I have the Bookmarks organized within Folders, sometimes there are other folders within a main folder… When I click on a Folder, it appears to disappear, leaving a blank space, but the contents are still shown. If I then click on another Folder, the one that disappeared, reappears… but now there is a blank space where I clicked on the second folder… Nothing actually is lost, but the name of the clicked Folder disappears, leaving a blank space… This is strange behaviour. I have Windows running under Parallels and the Windows Firefox still functions correctly without problems. On the Mac Firefox I have tried deleting all Bookmarks and re-importing, but doesn't help. I have also Refreshed Firefox and that does not help either. I do not really wish to delete and re-install the Firefox App. as I have many modifications, extensions, search engines etc. installed. Is this behaviour perhaps a quirk of Version 119.0??? Thanks for any help or advice. Colin
creator: Cobracon9

title: Downloads from Internet
content:
I have Firefox set to "Ask whether to open or save files" not to Save files. This never happened before, but now Firefox is not giving me the option to open or save files, and automatically starts the download without giving me the box with both options. I get the message Opening in x amount of time in the "Display the progress of ongoing download" button, instead of the remaining time of download where the file doesn't open when the download is finished.

How can this be corrected? I have a feeling something happened in a new version of Firefox.
creator: llaurienzo

title: Problém se zoomem
content: S novou verzí 119.0 se mi při stisknutí CTRL začne ihned zvětšovat písmo (dříve CTRL a +). Je to nepříjemné při používání CTRL C, CTRL V apod.
creator: rosikmail

title: Firefox crashes when opening local HTML file
content:
Firefox version: 119.0 (64-bit) OS: Windows 10 Home 64-bit


Hello,

Whenever I open a local HTML file, Firefox tab will crash. This happens if the HTML file size is big (>4MB), smaller file doesn't crash.

I've tried opening the file on Chrome, it doesn't crash and open just fine. So it seems like this is a bug with Firefox.

I've uploaded the HTML file if anyone wants to test: https://www.mediafire.com/file/ipmu7ugrd2vvelr/LICENSES.chromium.html.zip/file

Thanks
creator: cookie.master

title: I have a zombie reddit.com cookie that always comes back within seconds even though I blocked it
content:
I've had this for a few months now and it's driving me crazy.

I have blocked reddit.com, http://www.reddit.com, https://www.reddit.com, I delete the cookies, it keeps coming back. So I finally deleted every trace of Firefox off my computer, deleting the library files, everything. I download a brand new copy of Firefox, start it up and within seconds have a reddit.com cookie. There are no reddit pages open, no tabs, no nothing.

Also, I keep reading that you can right-click or control-click on a cookie to inspect it but that does not work for me on FF 115.4. I cannot find any way to look at the cookie code in Firefox.

I'm on the verge of just giving up on Firefox at this point. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
creator: photonboy

title: Won't switch to new tab when right-clicked
content:
I've searched for answers. I tried the About:config and changing some settings to false and others to true as suggested (e.g. browser.search.context.loadInBackground), etc., and of course I have the option chosen under settings.

This is a new computer. My old computer would switch to the new tab when I right click it, but this new one won't.

Any latest fixes?

title: Weird Firefox startup

title: Firefox window won't maximise
content: The last couple of days, Firefox opens in a three-quarter screen size window. I don't want "full-screen" mode but I do want the window to take up my whole desktop when I'm using it. There are no buttons to maximise or minimise and no dragging arrows when I hover over the edges. I don't know why this is happening all of a sudden. How do I fix it please?
creator: thelittlestjourno
